markdownRemark.html:
Ingredients

Serves: 4

  • 1 cup thick avalakki
  • 1/2 cup moong dal
  • 1/2 cup avarekaalu / green peas
  • 1/4 teaspoon turmeric
  • 1 teaspoon jeera crushed
  • 1 teaspoon pepper crushed
  • 4 green chillies slit into half
  • 1 inch ginger finely chopped
  • 1/2 cup fresh grated coconut
  • Corriander leaves
  • Water, Aesofotida, salt to taste and oil.

Method

  • Wash and pressure cook moong dal and avarekaalu / peas in 1 cup of water along with turmeric and salt added to it for 2-3 whistles.
  • In a wok, once the oil is heated add crushed jeera, pepper and aesofotida.
  • Add green chillies and ginger. Then add curry leaves.
  • Add the cooked moong dal mixture along with 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Stir.
  • Add grated coconut.
  • Once the mixture comes to a boil, wash and add the avalakki.
  • Let it boil for 5 minutes soaking most of the water. Turn off the stove, add corriander and let the dish come togeather while resting in a closed container for another 5 minutes.
  • Serve with ghee.

Tips

  • If the avarekaalu or the peas is tender, cook them eperately instead in the pressure cooker to keep them intact.
